item.title: 西门子歌美飒首席执行官在员工信中表示，将在大修中裁员 4100 人
item.description: 西门子能源陷入困境的风电部门西门子歌美飒（Siemens Gamesa）首席执行官约亨-艾克霍尔特（Jochen Eickholt）在路透社看到的一封致员工的内部信中表示，该部门计划裁员 4100 人，约占员工总数的 15%。【原文：Siemens Energy's troubled wind division Siemens Gamesa is planning to cut 4,100 jobs, or around 15% of its staff, the unit's CEO Jochen Eickholt said in an internal letter to staff seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 赫斯投资者将就雪佛龙交易进行投票，推迟交易的呼声日益高涨
item.description: 赫斯公司的股东将于周二就雪佛龙公司拟以 530 亿美元收购该公司一事进行投票表决，此前许多投资者呼吁推迟投票，希望能以更好的报价收购他们的股份。【原文：Hess Corp shareholders will vote on Tuesday on Chevron's proposed $53 billion acquisition of the company, after many investors have called for a delay in hopes of obtaining a better offer for their shares.】

item.title: 马斯克的神经链接公司在美国政府数据库中注册大脑植入研究
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的脑芯片初创公司 Neuralink 已在美国政府的临床试验数据库中登记了一项研究的详细资料，该研究将评估其设备在患者身上的效果。【原文：Elon Musk's brain-chip startup Neuralink has registered details about a study evaluating its device in patients on the U.S. government's database of clinical trials.】

item.title: 高层管理人员斯福尔扎将被任命为贝纳通首席执行官 - 消息来源
item.description: 本周二，两位知情人士透露，意大利高管克劳迪奥-斯福尔扎（Claudio Sforza）已被选为亏损服装集团贝纳通的首席执行官，接替即将离任的马西莫-雷诺（Massimo Renon）。【原文：Italian executive Claudio Sforza has been chosen as chief executive of loss-making clothing group Benetton, replacing outgoing Massimo Renon, two sources close to the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 大众汽车将开发售价约为 20,000 欧元的入门级电动汽车
item.description: 欧洲顶级汽车制造商大众汽车公司周二表示，该公司将开发低成本电动汽车，以更好地与激烈的中国竞争对手竞争。【原文：Volkswagen will develop low-cost electric vehicles in a bid to better compete with fierce Chinese rivals, Europe's top carmaker said on Tuesday, after talks with Renault to team up on the project collapsed earlier this month.】

item.title: 金宝公司重组生产工厂，将裁员 415 人
item.description: 金宝汤公司（Campbell Soup）周二表示，计划缩小印第安纳州杰弗逊维尔（Jeffersonville）生产基地的规模，并关闭俄勒冈州图拉丁（Tualatin）生产基地，从而裁员 415 人。【原文：Campbell Soup on Tuesday said it plans to reduce the size of its Jeffersonville, Indiana site and close Tualatin, Oregon site, leading to 415 job cuts.】

item.title: 独家报道：阿根廷有望在 7 月开始向中国出口玉米 - 谷物商会负责人
item.description: 阿根廷谷物出口商会周二告诉路透社，阿根廷有望从 7 月份开始向中国装运期待已久的玉米，这将大大促进这个世界第三大谷物供应国--南美国家的发展。这将大大促进南美这个世界第三大谷物供应国的发展。【原文：Argentina is on track to start long-awaited corn shipments to China from July, the country's grain export chamber told Reuters on Tuesday, which would be a major boost for the South American nation, the world's no. 3 supplier of the grain.】

item.title: 在华尔街掀起一波看涨行情后，维京涨势喜人
item.description: 包括摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）和瑞银（UBS）在内的多家华尔街券商已开始对维京控股公司（Viking Holdings）进行报道，看好这家旅游和游轮公司在不断扩大的全球度假市场中的发展机遇。【原文：Several Wall Street brokerages, including J.P. Morgan and UBS, have started coverage on Viking Holdings , with a bullish view on the travel and cruise company's growth opportunities in an expanding global vacations market.】

item.title: 华尔街迎来更快贸易结算新时代
item.description: 周二，美国交易开始采用较短的结算时间，监管机构希望这将降低全球最大金融市场的风险并提高效率，但可能会暂时导致投资者的交易失败率上升。【原文：U.S. trading moved to a shorter settlement on Tuesday, which regulators hope will reduce risk and improve efficiency in the world's largest financial market but may temporarily lead to a rise in transaction failure for investors.】

item.title: 五月中旬巴西消费价格涨幅低于预期
item.description: 统计机构巴西地理统计局（IBGE）周二公布的数据显示，截至五月中旬，巴西消费者物价涨幅低于预期，原因是近期洪灾对食品通胀的影响比人们最初担心的要轻。【原文：Consumer prices in Brazil rose less than expected in the month to mid-May, data from statistics agency IBGE showed on Tuesday, as the impact on food inflation from recent floods turned out to be lighter than initially feared.】

item.title: 美国 5 月消费者信心意外提升
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于对劳动力市场持乐观态度，美国消费者信心在连续三个月恶化之后，在5月份意外地有所改善。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly improved in May after deteriorating for three consecutive months amid optimism about the labor market, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易所运营商在短暂停顿后重新启用会员交易所路由功能
item.description: 几家交易所运营商在短暂关闭会员交易所（MEMX）的路由功能后，于周二重新启用了路由功能。【原文：Several exchange operators on Tuesday re-enabled routing to Members Exchange (MEMX) after disabling it for a brief period.】

item.title: Gap、Abercrombie业绩将显示商场购物者是否挥霍无度
item.description: 继大型零售商沃尔玛（Walmart）和塔吉特（Target）的业绩喜忧参半之后，本周美国商场服装连锁店的业绩将更清晰地反映出美国人在进入夏季后是否会在服装和配饰上大手大脚。【原文：Results from U.S. mall-based apparel chains this week will give a clearer picture of whether Americans are splurging on clothes and accessories heading into summer following mixed results from big retailers Walmart and Target.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，激进投资者 Elliott 以 25 亿美元入股德州仪器
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二报道，激进投资者 Elliott 已持有德州仪器价值 25 亿美元的股份，并敦促这家芯片制造商改善其自由现金流。【原文：Activist investor Elliott has taken a stake worth $2.5 billion in Texas Instruments and urged the chipmaker to improve its free cash flow, CNBC reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 耐克在德国与阿迪达斯的条纹纠纷上诉中部分胜诉
item.description: 耐克公司可以在德国的一些裤子设计上印上三道条纹，周二，一家法院在第二次上诉听证会上做出了这一裁决，美国运动服装制造商与规模较小的竞争对手阿迪达斯展开了激烈的竞争。【原文：Nike can put three stripes on some of its trouser designs in Germany, a court ruled on Tuesday, in a second appeal hearing pitting the U.S. sports apparel maker against its smaller rival Adidas .】

item.title: 美国联邦住房与家庭管理局（FHFA）称 3 月份美国房价通胀放缓
item.description: 周二的数据显示，3月份美国房价增速大幅放缓，可能是由于抵押贷款利率上升拖累了需求。【原文：U.S. house price growth slowed sharply in March, likely as rising mortgage rates weighed on demand, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 诺福克南方公司任命前加拿大国民公司总裁 Mongeau 为新董事会主席
item.description: 诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）在周二的一份声明中说，该公司已任命前加拿大国家铁路公司首席执行官克劳德-蒙乔（Claude Mongeau）为新的董事会主席，立即生效。【原文：Norfolk Southern has named former Canadian National Railway CEO Claude Mongeau as the new chair of its board, effective immediately, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 比亚迪推出油耗更低的新型混合动力汽车技术
item.description: 中国比亚迪于本周二推出了最新一代插电式混合动力技术，该技术在耗尽电池的情况下实现了创纪录的百公里 2.9 升（62.1 英里）低油耗。【原文：China's BYD on Tuesday launched its latest generation of a plug-in hybrid technology that achieves a record low fuel consumption of 2.9 litres per 100 km (62.1 miles) on depleted batteries.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》Dealbook 报道，Adam Neumann 结束了收购 WeWork 的竞标
item.description: 亚当-诺伊曼（Adam Neumann）周二告诉《纽约时报》Dealbook，他已经结束了重新收购 WeWork 的竞标，因为这家由他联合创办的协同办公企业选择以 "不切实际 "的计划摆脱破产。【原文：Adam Neumann has ended his bid to re-acquire WeWork as the coworking business he co-founded has chosen to emerge from bankruptcy with an "unrealistic" plan, he told the New York Times Dealbook on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国恒大清算人寻求重组投资者
item.description: 中国恒大集团周二表示，其清算人正在邀请潜在投资者对公司进行重组。【原文：Property firm China Evergrande Group said on Tuesday its liquidators are inviting potential investors to pursue a restructuring in the company.】

item.title: 美国正在加快股票结算速度，其他国家呢？
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会于 2023 年 2 月通过了一项规则，将证券交易的结算周期从交易后两个工作日缩短为一个工作日，从本周二开始生效。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission adopted a rule in February 2023 to shorten the settlement cycle for securities transactions from two business days after the trade to one, beginning on Tuesday.】

item.title: 萨瓦德尔银行告诉股东，BBVA 的竞购过程可能会持续到 2025 年
item.description: 西班牙萨瓦德尔银行（Sabadell）正告诉零售股东，他们可能要到 2025 年才会对 BBVA 122.3 亿欧元（133 亿美元）的恶意收购做出决定，因为该银行正试图阻止这一收购。【原文：Spanish lender Sabadell is telling retail shareholders that they may have until 2025 before deciding on BBVA's 12.23 billion euro ($13.3 billion) hostile takeover attempt, as it seeks to stave off the bid.】

item.title: T-Mobile 以 44 亿美元收购 US Cellular 的无线业务
item.description: 电信巨头 T-Mobile 周二表示，将收购地区运营商 United States Cellular 的大部分无线业务，包括客户、商店和 30% 的频谱资产，交易价值为 44 亿美元。【原文：T-Mobile will buy substantially all of regional carrier United States Cellular's wireless operations, including customers, stores and 30% of its spectrum assets, in a deal valued at $4.4 billion, the telecom giant said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR-SingTel 财团是以 10 亿美元收购数据中心供应商股份的领跑者
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，KKR 和新加坡电信（SingTel）组成的财团已成为收购亚洲最大数据中心供应商之一价值 10 亿美元少数股权的领跑者。【原文：A consortium of KKR and Singapore Telecommunications (SingTel) has emerged as the frontrunner to buy a minority stake worth $1 billion in one of Asia's biggest data centre providers, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 解说员：美国加快股票交割的预期
item.description: 2023 年 2 月美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）通过一项新规定后，美国股票、公司市政债券和其他证券的结算时间将减半至一天，即 T+1，本周二美国市场将迎来一场动荡。【原文：U.S. markets are set for an upheaval on Tuesday when the settlement time for U.S. equities, corporate municipal bonds and other securities will be halved to one day, or T+1, after the adoption of a new Securities and Exchange Commission rule in February 2023.】

item.title: 美国对中国进口医疗产品加征关税面临业界质疑，因为出现了替代供应商
item.description: 业内高管表示，美国对来自中国的医用手套、注射器和口罩征收更高的关税不太可能提高美国生产商的竞争力，因为预计其他低成本供应商会抢先填补这一缺口。【原文：Higher U.S. tariffs on medical gloves, syringes and face masks from China are unlikely to make U.S. producers more competitive, as other low-cost suppliers are expected to rush in to fill the gap, industry executives said.】

item.title: Meme 股票 GameStop 在售股筹资 9.33 亿美元后大涨
item.description: Meme 股票 GameStop 周二在盘前交易中飙升近 20%，因为这家陷入困境的电子游戏零售商称，在本月早些时候的市场反弹中，它通过出售股票筹集了超过 9 亿美元的资金。【原文：Meme stock GameStop soared nearly 20% in premarket trading on Tuesday after the struggling videogame retailer said it had raised over $900 million from selling its shares during the market rally earlier this month.】

item.title: 瑞银将标普 500 指数年底目标上调至 5600 点的最高水平
item.description: 瑞银全球研究公司（UBS Global Research）周二将基准 S&P 500 指数的年终目标上调至 5600 点，在主要券商中预测最高。【原文：UBS Global Research raised its year-end target for the benchmark S&P 500 index to 5,600 points on Tuesday, marking the highest forecast among major brokerages.】

item.title: 市场等待通胀数据，期指稳步上扬
item.description: 在周末假期结束后，美国股指期货周二走高，投资者在等待本周晚些时候的一份关键通胀报告，该报告可能会对美联储的货币政策前景预期构成考验。【原文：U.S. stock index futures ticked higher on Tuesday after a holiday-extended weekend, as investors awaited a key inflation report later in the week that could test expectations of the Federal Reserve's monetary policy outlook.】

item.title: 加快股票交收为 ETF 市场带来独特障碍
item.description: 市场参与者表示，美国证券交易周二将改为次日结算，这将要求交易所交易基金（ETF）和做市商兼顾多个司法管辖区的要求和资本需求。【原文：The move to next-day settlement for trading in U.S. securities on Tuesday will require exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and the marketmakers to juggle multiple jurisdictional requirements and capital needs, market participants said.】
